moves.1... f5: Didn't expect that one, did ya??
moves.2. Bg2 c6 3. b3 Nf6 4. Bb2: OK, attack the Knight...one of his few moves I liked.
moves.4... d5: Took a chance here with a bad move.  If he takes my knight I'm in bad shape!
moves.5. Bd4: He wimps out, sealing his own fate.
moves.8... O-O: Now, my king is safe and i OWN the center.  He has absolutely no chance!
moves.12. O-O fxg3: Ripping down the defense a pawn at a time
moves.13. hxg3 e4: Notice how all of my pieces are in postion to attack a very suspect defense.  Also, He has not developed his Queens knight and his King's Knight is hanging out in an alley!
moves.16. Rf2 exf3 17. Nxf3 Ne4: I decided to move to open up the queen and bishop's diagonal.....I mean, who am i to say they cant join in on the action??
moves.18. Re2 Ndf6: Now, all my pieces are ready.  queen and both bishops have open diagonals, rook is well placed (Although i really want him on the f- file) and both knights are waiting for a FORK
moves.19... Bxg4 20. d3: Not sure what that move was supposed to accomplish
moves.20... Ng3 21. Re1 Qd7: Getting ready to attack his bishop!
moves.22. Qd2 Bh3:
OK, lets just look at the board here.  He has not ONE piece past 4 rank.  His pieces look like a bunch of hobo's trying to stay warm on a winter night (that's not me, that's Robert Frost).  

Again, Im in attack mode trying to get rid of pieces now.
moves.23. Ng5 Bxg2 24. Kxg2: Why did he position his queen there and then take with his King.  Bad move you will see after 24...Qg4!!
moves.24... Qg4 25. Nf3 Nge4+ 26. Kh1 Nxd2: Game over.  He never had a chance.
